question.text:
The following compounds are intermediates in the pathway of photorespiration

I. phosphoglycolate II. serine III. glyoxylate IV. glycine

The correct sequence of their appearance in the pathway is

solution.text: Photorespiration is a metabolic process occurring in C3 plants, which is dependent on light and results in evolution of   <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> .  Rubisco enzyme catalyses fixation of  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  instead of   <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  fixation which occurs during dark phase of photosynthesis. During this process 3-phosphoglycerate and 2-phosphoglycolate are formed, out of which 2-phosphoglycolate are not useful to the plants and it might interfere in functioning of chloroplast. Overall photorespiration pathway involves movement of intermediate metabolites in various cell organelles.
